NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE REGIONAL DIRECTOR
2151 Highland Avenue
Birmingham 5, Alabama
Mr. William G. Harley
President, NAEB
DuPont Circle Office Building
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Bill:
It was good to see you again and to work with you in Philadelphia and New
York City. If there is anything I can do to further the project, I am at your
command.
It came to my attention from Ken Wright that Ed Wegener, as consultant to
the Chattanooga and Nashville ETV situations, was using a copy of the HEW
regulations on the ETV matching legislation. He obtained this copy from
Dave Stewart. This provoked Ken Wright because discussion was going on
in Tennessee about the regulations which were unfamiliar to him. These,
I am sure, were not intended to have been released, or why shouldn't we all
have had them? Can you check this with the HEW and determine the facts?
I wish to have my name kept out of it, if possible.

The following are the requested recommendations for restructuring the NAEB
and are based upon the premise that a NAEB grass roots organization located
in every state will be wisely building for the future and on the most democratic
basis:
STATE CHAPTERS
tn every state possible, there should be a chapter of the NAEB.
a. This chapter would be composed of persons permitted NAEB
membership.
b. The state chapters would organize with a president, secretary
and other desired officers.
c. Each state chapter would elect a regional council member.
d. State chapters would hold meetings designed to their needs
and held when and where they should desire.
October 30, 1962
